Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.10430870]Gram-positive bacterium:Staphylococcus aureus (MIC=0.19 µM).Gram-negative bacterium:Proteus vulgaris (MIC=54.6 µM).Fungi:Candida kefyr (MIC=18.6 µM) and Candida tropicalis (MIC=19.4 µM).NOTE:Medium with 10 mM phosphate buffer.[Ref.18008336]Virus:HIV:inhibition the cytopathic effects of HIV-1 infection in cultured human T-lymphoblast (CEM-SS) cells(EC50=40-260 nM).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Ref.10430870] EC50 = 1020 μM against blood type A human erythrocytes.
Sequence Information.Structure Description: The molecule is stabilised by three disulfide bonds, two of which form an embedded loop completed by the backbone fragments connecting the cysteine residues. A third disulfide bond threads through the centre of this loop to form a "cystine-knot" motif. This motif is present in a range of other biologically active proteins, including omega-contoxin GVIA and Cucurbita maxima trypsin inhibitor.
Sequence Information.Function: Probably participates in a plant defense mechanism. Has antibiotic activity. Inhibits the cytopathic effects and replication of the human immunodeficiency virus. Relatively ineffective against Gram-negative bacteria such as E. coli and P. aeruginosa.
Sequence Information.PTM: This is a cyclic peptide which contains three disulfide bonds 1-17; 5-19; 10-24.
